rules.boostTiming: Boosts can only be applied before the match starts

constraints.matchPredictionTime: You can change your predictions for each match up to one hour before it starts
constraints.podiumPredictionTime: You can modify podium and individual awards predictions up to 2 days after the tournament starts
constraints.singlePrediction: Only one prediction per person is allowed, but the same prediction can be used in multiple groups
constraints.qualifiedTeamsPredictionTime: You can modify qualified teams predictions up to 2 days after the tournament starts

examples.winnerDraw: Example: If you predict Argentina will beat Brazil and Argentina indeed wins, you get {points} {points, plural, one {point} other {points}}. If you predict a draw and the match ends in a draw, you also get {points} {points, plural, one {point} other {points}}.
examples.exactScore: Example: If you predict Argentina will win 2-1 against Brazil and the final score is exactly 2-1, you get {total} {total, plural, one {point} other {points}} ({correctOutcome} for the winner + {bonus} extra for exact score).
examples.roundOf16: Example: If you predict Argentina will qualify for the Round of 16 and they indeed qualify, you get {points} {points, plural, one {point} other {points}} for that qualified team.
examples.groupPosition: Example: If you predict Argentina will finish first in Group A and they indeed finish first, you get {totalPoints} additional {totalPoints, plural, one {point} other {points}} ({qualifiedPoints} for qualifying + {exactPositionPoints} for exact position = {totalPoints} total points).
examples.champion: Example: If you predict Argentina will be champion and Argentina indeed wins the tournament, you get {points} {points, plural, one {point} other {points}}. If Argentina reaches the final but loses, you don't get the points.
examples.runnerUp: Example: If you predict Brazil will be runner-up and Brazil indeed loses the final, you get {points} {points, plural, one {point} other {points}}.
examples.thirdPlace: Example: If you predict France will be third and France indeed wins the third place match, you get {points} {points, plural, one {point} other {points}}.
examples.individualAwards: Example: If you predict Lionel Messi will win the best player award and he indeed wins it, you get {points} {points, plural, one {point} other {points}}. The same applies for other awards (goalkeeper, top scorer, etc.).
examples.matchPredictionTime: Example: If a match starts at 3:00 PM, you can modify your prediction until 2:00 PM. After that time, the prediction is locked.
examples.podiumPredictionTime: Example: If the tournament starts on June 1st, you can modify your champion, runner-up, and third place predictions until June 3rd at 11:59 PM.
examples.singlePrediction: Example: You can only have one active prediction, but that same prediction can be used in your friends' group, your office group, and any other group you join.
examples.qualifiedTeamsPredictionTime: Example: If the tournament starts on June 1st, you can modify your qualified teams predictions until June 3rd at 11:59 PM.
